===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ゆ}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ゆ}}. In modern {{etyl|ja|-}}, only found as a prefix in compounds.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ゆ}}

====Prefix====
{{ja-pos|prefix|ゆ}}

# a [[bow]], a bow [[shape]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|弓懸}}, {{ja-l|弽}}, {{ja-r|韘|ゆがけ}}:
* {{ja-l|弓束}}, {{ja-l|弓柄}}, {{ja-r|弣|ゆづか}}:
* {{ja-r|弓末|ゆずえ}}:
* {{ja-r|弓弦|ゆづる}}: a [[bowstring]]
* {{ja-l|弓弭}}, {{ja-l|弓筈}}, {{ja-r|弓彇|ゆはず}}: a [[nock]] on a [[bow]] where the [[bowstring]] sits
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|弓 (楽器)}}
{{wikipedia|Bow (music)}}
[[File:Bows-ViolaBassGdulkaKemence.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|弓}} (''yumi''): Four different types of '''bow'''.]]
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|弓 (武器)}}
{{wikipedia|Bow and arrow}}
[[File:Yumi-p1000624.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|弓}} (''yu'', ''yumi'', ''tarashi'', ''kyū''): Japanese '''bows''', arrows, and arrow-stand.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ゆみ}}
Appears to be {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ゆみ}} ''yu'' + suffixing element ''mi'', itself of uncertain derivation.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ゆみ|acc=2|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ゆみ}}

# a [[bow]]:
## {{lb|ja|weaponry|sort=ゆみ}} a bow for shooting [[arrow]]s
## {{lb|ja|musical instrument|sort=ゆみ}} a bow for playing a [[stringed instrument]] such as a [[violin]] or [[cello]]
# [[archery]]
# {{lb|ja|Shinto|sort=ゆみ}} a type of [[kagura]] (sacred Shinto song and dance) intended to drive away [[evil]]
# short for {{ja-r|破魔弓|はま ゆみ}}: a ceremonial archery bow with the power to dispel evil
# a bow [[shape]], a [[curve]]
# a bow-shaped [[tool]] used to [[beat]] [[ginned]] [[cotton]] into a softer and finer [[textile]]

* {{ja-l|重籐弓}}, {{ja-l|滋籐弓}}, {{ja-r|繁籐弓|しげどう ゆみ}}: a [[rattan]] wood bow

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|たらし}}
Alteration from ''torashi'', {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem or continuative form}} of verb ''torasu'', from ''tora'' as the {{m|ja|未然形|tr=mizenkei||incomplete form}} of verb {{m|ja|取る|tr=toru||to take}} + {{m|ja|す|tr=su|pos=honorific suffix in {{etyl|ojp|-}}}}. Original meaning was “something kept [[to hand]]”.<ref name="KDJ"/><ref name="DJR"/>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|たらし}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|執}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|たらし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=たらし|rare|honorific}} an [[archery]] [[bow]], particularly one belonging to a [[noble]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-l|御執}}, {{ja-l|御弓|みたらし|mitarashi}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|きゅう}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=きゅう}} {{m|zh|弓|tr=*giung}}.<ref name="KDJ"/><ref name="DJR"/> Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{m|zh|弓|tr=gōng}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kan|きゅう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|きゅう}}

# {{lb|ja|rare|sort=きゅう}} a [[bow]]
# {{lb|ja|obsolete|sort=きゅう}} in [[ancient]] [[Chinese]] [[archery]], a [[unit]] of [[length]] for measuring the [[distance]] between the [[archer]] and the [[target]]; one ''kyū'' was equal to six {{m|ja|尺|tr=shaku}}, roughly six [[feet]] or 182 [[centimeter]]s
# {{lb|ja|obsolete|sort=きゅう}} in [[ancient]] [[China]], a [[unit]] of [[length]] for [[survey]]ing [[land]]; one ''kyū'' was equal to eight {{m|ja|尺|tr=shaku}}, roughly eight [[feet]] or 242 [[centimeter]]s

=====Usage notes=====
In modern {{etyl|ja|-}}, the reading ''kyū'' is most often found in compounds.

* {{ja-r|弓道|きゅうどう|}}: [[archery]] as a [[martial art]]
* {{ja-r|大弓|だいきゅう}}: a [[great]] [[bow]], a [[long bow]]
* {{ja-r|半弓|はんきゅう}}: a [[half]] [[bow]], a [[short bow]]
{{der-bottom}}
